thread.title: Rewinding Alabama's 19-14 win against Tennessee - AL.com
thread.title_full: Rewinding Alabama's 19-14 win against Tennessee - AL.com

title: Rewinding Alabama's 19-14 win against Tennessee - AL.com
text:
Comments 
A Ryan Anderson strip-sack preserved Alabama's seventh win of the season and set up a huge showdown in two weeks against LSU. 
Anderson hit an unsuspecting Joshua Dobbs to force a fumble and A'Shawn Robinson recovered it to guarantee the 19-14 win for the Tide. 
Derrick Henry led the way with 143 yards and two touchdowns to power the Tide offensively. 
FOURTH QUARTER: Alabama 19, Tennessee 14 
--Alabama will likely kneel the ball and run out the clock here. 
--Ryan Anderson sacks Josh Dobbs and forces a fumble, which A'Shawn Robinson recovers. Alabama gets ball on Tennessee's 4-yard line. 
--Jonathan Allen sacks Dobbs and Bryant-Denny Stadium explodes in cheers. 
--Tennessee will start at the 25-yard line. Vols easily moved the ball downfield on their last drive. 
--Derrick Henry scores a 14-yard touchdown to put Alabama back up. Alabama doesn't convert the two-point conversion and is up 19-14 with 2:24 remaining in the game. 
--After a big catch by Calvin Ridley, Alabama has the ball on Tennessee's 19-yard line with 3:02 remaining in the game down by one point. 
--ArDarius Stewart makes an incredible catch. Officials are reviewing the call, but looks like it will stand as a catch. 
--Tennessee easily moves the ball downfield on two big Dobbs throws, capped off by a 12-yard Hurd touchdown. Tennessee takes a 1-point lead with 5:49 left in the game. 
--Important drive for Tennessee here. Dobbs starts it off with a 27-yard pass to Smith to move Vols to midfield. 
--Adam Griffith hit a 28-yard field goal to give Alabama a 13-7 lead against Tennessee with 7:08 remaining in the game. 
--ArDarius Stewart made two big catches on an extended drive. He's up to five catches for 85 yards. 
--Derrick Henry has hit the 100-yard mark on this drive. He's up to 100 yards and a touchdown on 20 carries. 
--O.J. Howard makes his seventh catch of the day for a first down. He now has 55 yards receiving. 
--Minkah Fitzpatrick dropped an interception -- Alabama's third dropped INT -- but Tennessee field goal kicker Aaron Medley missed his third field goal of the game. 
--Tennessee will start the fourth quarter on Alabama's 31-yard line. 
THIRD QUARTER: Alabama 10, Tennessee 7 
--Tennessee has a nice drive going at the moment. 
--Alabama gets the ball back at the 30-yard line after forcing a three-and-out. Alabama gets a false start and then Coker gets sacked to doom the drive. Scott had a beautiful punt to give the Vols the ball on its 10-yard line. 
--Eddie Jackson returned to the game for Tennessee's first second-half drive. He missed most of the first half with an injury. 
--Coker finds Stewart for a 26-yard gain to give Alabama first-and-goal from Tennessee's 8-yd line. The next play Coker hits O.J. Howard who gets down to the 1-yard line, but Alabama can't punch it in on its next two plays. Alabama settles for a 19-yard field goal. 
--Alabama offense with some momentum to start the half. Heavy dose of Henry to start things off and then two first-down passes to Ridley and Richard Mullaney, respectively. 
--Alabama starts with the ball at its own 25-yard line. 
SECOND QUARTER: Alabama 7, Tennessee 7 
--Tennessee outgained Alabama 102-40 on the ground in the first half. Jalen Hurd had 65 yards on 11 carries -- only five yards shy of the average amount of rushing yards Alabama has given up per game this season. 
--Aaron Medley missed a 51-yard field goal to end the first half. The Tide will get the ball to start the second half. 
--Tennessee has the ball on Alabama's 33-yard line with four seconds remaining in the first half. The Vols will attempt the field goal after missing an earlier 43-yard attempt. 
--Ronnie Harrison went down with an injury. He replaced starting safety Eddie Jackson who went down with an apparent knee injury earlier in the game and hasn't returned. Harrison was walked straight to the locker room with the help of trainers. 
--A Kenyan Drake unsportsmanlike penalty ends Alabama's drive and forces another JK Scott penalty. He delivers a good one and backs Tennessee up to its 31-yard line. 
--Alabama continues to get good pressure on Tennessee QB Josh Dobbs. Dobbs made another poor throw, but Reuben Foster couldn't intercept it. The Volunteers punted for the third time in the first half. 
--Jake Coker throws his first interception of the game. He telegraphed his throw and Brian Randolph jumped the route. It is his first interception since the Arkansas game and seventh of the season. 
--Josh Dobbs made a very poor throw but Ronnie Harrison couldn't come down with the interception. Still, Tennessee was forced to punt. 
--Alabama's drive stalled on the 50-yard line after left tackle Cam Robinson got beat and Coker was sacked. The Volunteers have two sacks and two QB hurries early in the first half. 
--Tennessee will start the second quarter with 2-and-12 on its own 18-yard line. Alabama forces the Vols to punt after a sack backed them up. It was a shaky punt but a fortunate roll backs the Tide up to its 33-yard line. 
FIRST QUARTER: Alabama 7, Tennessee 7 
-- Alabama was moving ball fairly well on its drive but after Jake Coker gets sacked, faces a 3rd-and-20 on Tennessee's 46-yd line. Alabama is forced to punt after Vols DL LaTroy Lewis gets immediate pressure on Coker. 
-- Josh Dobbs connects with Josh Smith on an 11-yard touchdown to tie the game at 7-7 with three minutes remaining in the first quarter. Tennessee ran 10 plays for 75 yards and ate up 4:14 of clock on that drive. Dobbs looking good early against Alabama and has done a nice job, for the most part, of evading pressure. 
-- Tennessee, like most teams, hasn't had much success trying to run through the middle of the field against Alabama, but has made a few nice plays either running out wide or throwing to running backs in the flats. 
-- After attempting to test out his knee with a brace, safety Eddie Jackson headed to the locker room with trainer Jeff Allen. 
-- Henry broke through at least two tackles for a 20-yard touchdown run to get Alabama on the scoreboard first. When he gets churning, he's very difficult to take down. The offensive line got the job done, as well. 
-- Derrick Henry gets the ball on Alabama's first offensive play. A Tennessee defensive penalty gives Alabama the ball at the 40-yard line. 
-- After a Reuben Foster sack pushes the Vols back, Tennessee missed a 43-yard field goal. 
-- Safety Eddie Jackson, who leads the SEC with five interceptions, suffered an apparent right knee injury and left the game. 
- Tennessee will start its first drive at its own 25-yard line. 
PREGAME 
--Alabama won the toss and deferred to the second half. Tennessee will start with the ball. 
--Former Alabama running back Alvin Kamara was one of Tennessee's three team captains. Reggie Ragland, O.J. Howard and Jonathan Allen were Alabama's three team captains. 
--Former Tennessee great Peyton Manning made the trip to Bryant-Denny Stadium and was walking the sidelines before the game. 
Nick Saban told ESPN's Joe Schad that center Ryan Kelly has been cleared to play today. Kelly suffered a concussion against Texas A&M and had been going through concussion protocols through the week.
